body: \text{Define a matrix. Give an example of a } 2 \times 3 \text{ matrix.}
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \text{ and } B = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ find } A + B.
\text{Calculate the transpose of the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & -1 & 2 \\ 0 & 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}.
\text{Define a diagonal matrix and give an example of a } 3 \times 3 \text{ diagonal matrix.}
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \text{, find } 2A.
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{bmatrix} \text{, find the order of the matrix.}
\text{Define a symmetric matrix. Give an example of a } 2 \times 2 \text{ symmetric matrix.}
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 4 \\ 1 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \text{ and } B = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 5 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ find } A - B.
\text{Define an identity matrix and provide an example of a } 3 \times 3 \text{ identity matrix.}
\text{Show that the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & -1 \\ 4 & 2 \end{bmatrix} \text{ is invertible by finding } A^{-1}.
\text{For the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ determine if } A \text{ is a scalar matrix.}
\text{Define a zero matrix. Provide an example of a } 2 \times 3 \text{ zero matrix.}
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 0 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \text{, find } A^2.
\text{Explain the concept of equality of matrices.}
\text{Find the trace of the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}.
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \text{ and } B = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ find } AB.
\text{Determine whether the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 2 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \text{ is symmetric.}
\text{Define a column matrix. Provide an example of a } 3 \times 1 \text{ column matrix.}
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -1 \end{bmatrix} \text{, show that } A^T = A.
\text{Explain the distributive property of matrix addition.}
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \text{ and } B = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ -2 & 0 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ verify that } (A + B)^T = A^T + B^T.
\text{Find the determinant of the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 4 \end{bmatrix}.
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \text{, find } A^{-1}.
\text{Define a square matrix and provide an example of a } 2 \times 2 \text{ square matrix.}
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & 4 \\ 2 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \text{ and } B = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ find } AB.
\text{Explain why matrix multiplication is not commutative.}
\text{Determine if the matrix } A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -2 \\ -2 & 2 \end{bmatrix} \text{ is symmetric or skew-symmetric.}
\text{If } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \text{ and } B = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}, \text{ find } A - B.
\text{Find the scalar multiplication } 3 \times \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}.
